description: One of the largest conure species, the Patagonian Conure, or Burrowing Parrot, is primarily olive-brown with a white eye-ring, white patches on the breast, and a red and yellow belly.
temperament: Intelligent, inquisitive, and can be quite gentle and affectionate. They are known for their clownish antics but are less 'hyper' than many smaller conures.
loudness: Extremely Loud. They have a very loud, harsh, and grating call, which makes them unsuitable for many home environments.
vocalization: Can learn to talk, but they are not known for their clarity. They are more likely to be loud with their natural calls.
dietaryNeeds: A diet based on high-quality pellets, with a variety of fresh vegetables, some fruit, and nuts. They enjoy chewing, so providing foraging opportunities is great.
healthPointers: A very hardy species that can live for 30+ years. They need an extremely durable cage and lots of chew toys to keep their powerful beaks busy.
housing: Absolutely not suitable for apartments. Their noise is extreme. They need a very large and strong cage or aviary, minimum 40"W x 30"D x 60"H.
